---
slug: /152
title: "This Week In React #152: React 18, RSC, Kuma UI, Expo 49, Next.js, Remix DevTools, Fresh, React-Query, Redwood, Catalyst, Million, MDXEditor, Ariakit, Rewind, TC39, Prettier..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 07-18-2023
---
I've just got back from holiday in French Brittany ğŸ˜, so we're covering 2 weeks of news in this edition.
I thought it was going to be a quiet summer, but there have been quite a few releases and plenty of articles on Server Components! ğŸ˜„
**ğŸ’¡ [Check this newsletter on Twitter](https://slo.im/thread) - visual format ğŸ¨**
[![Tina.io is a headless CMS for Markdown-powered sites](/emails/issues/140/tinacms.jpg)](https://tina.io/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=this-week-in-react)
**[Tina.io is a headless CMS for Markdown-powered sites](https://tina.io/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=this-week-in-react)**

- Editing UI for your Markdown files
- UI for MDX components
- Supports static (SSG) and server-side rendering (SSR)
- Option for visual editing (live-preview)
- Build with reusable blocks

Comprehensive, well-illustrated article on React 18 and its impact on performance. Explains how Concurrent React works and its impact on metrics such as Total Blocking Time and Interaction to Next Paint. Also presents other new features such as the Transition API, React Server Components, Suspense and the new React cache.

translations.zh-hant: é—œæ–¼ React 18 åŠå…¶å°æ•ˆèƒ½å½±éŸ¿çš„å…¨é¢ä¸”åœ–æ–‡ä¸¦èŒ‚çš„æ–‡ç« ã€‚è§£é‡‹äº†ä¸¦è¡Œ React çš„å·¥ä½œåŸç†åŠå…¶å°ç¸½é˜»å¡æ™‚é–“ï¼ˆTotal Blocking Timeï¼‰å’Œäº¤äº’åˆ°ä¸‹ä¸€æ¬¡ç¹ªè£½ï¼ˆInteraction to Next Paintï¼‰ç­‰æŒ‡æ¨™çš„å½±éŸ¿ã€‚åŒæ™‚ä¹Ÿä»‹ç´¹äº†å…¶ä»–æ–°åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚éæ¸¡ APIï¼ˆTransition APIï¼‰ã€React ä¼ºæœå™¨å…ƒä»¶ï¼ˆReact Server Componentsï¼‰ã€Suspense ä»¥åŠæ–°çš„ React å¿«å–ï¼ˆcacheï¼‰ã€‚

segments.source_content: New CSS-in-JS library inspired by the DX offered by Chakra UI, and compatible with React Server Components. The library is based on a unique hybride method that combines the best of zero-runtime CSS-in-JS and traditional runtime solutions. We'll have to study all this, and see how this library stands up to [Panda CSS](https://panda-css.com/) from the Chakra team.

- ğŸ¦ [DevRel Matt Carroll rejoined the React team](https://twitter.com/mattcarrollcode/status/1681342638816112641)
- ğŸ‘€ [How to Setup Redwood Experimental React Server Components](https://community.redwoodjs.com/t/react-server-components-rsc/5081)

- ğŸ“œ [My take on the current React & Server Components controversy](https://phryneas.de/react-server-components-controversy): Lenz loves the React Server Components but explains his frustration as a maintainer of Apollo Client and Redux Toolkit.
- ğŸ“œ [Demystifying React Server Components with NextJS 13 App Router](https://demystifying-rsc.vercel.app/): a great demo application with well-illustrated notes explaining how Server Components work, including many code and network payload samples.
- ğŸ“œ [5 Common Pitfalls with Server Components in Next13 (with examples)](https://www.propelauth.com/post/5-common-pitfalls-with-server-components-in-next13-with-examples): well-illustrated article presenting the most common errors when using Server Components.
- ğŸ“œ [Trimming typography with Capsize](https://www.skovy.dev/blog/using-capsize-with-stitches): explains how to trim and normalise whitespaces around your fonts to facilitate alignment, in a React context.
- ğŸ“œ [SvelteJS: My ecosystem is bigger than yours](https://hackmd.io/@roguegpu/r1RKQMdt3): interesting criticism of React in favour of Svelte, which doesn't need as much of an ecosystem.

The new SDK 49 has just been released. Many new features have been announced, including my favourites:

- React Native 0.72.3, React Native Web 0.19.6
- Expo Router v2.0
- Network debugging, VS Code debugging
- React devtools built-in
- Environment variables
- Local Expo Modules
- EAS Insights

- React Native 0.72.3, React Native Web 0.19.6
- Expo Router v2.0

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!
